title: Building and Understanding our Expected Goals (xG) Models
text: example walks expected goals (xG) models nhlscraper built interpret . goals twofold: first, show features contribute shot attempt’s xG value; second, demonstrate package’s data acquisition cleaning utilities support modeling workflow. hockey-related technical terms definitions (e.g., Corsi/SAT, Fenwick/USAT, rebound, rush), can access glossary.
code: # Load library. library(nhlscraper)  # Access glossary. glossary <- nhlscraper::glossary()

title: Building and Understanding our Expected Goals (xG) Models
text: begin assembling dataset used fit evaluate xG models. earlier versions workflow, manually loop every game seasons interest, fetch game’s play--play, stitch together demonstrated legacy code . new update 0.4.0, process much simpler: can retrieve full season’s worth play--plays single function call, combine multiple seasons one modeling dataset.
code: # Load data. gc_pbps_20222023 <- nhlscraper::gc_pbps(20222023) gc_pbps_20232024 <- nhlscraper::gc_pbps(20232024) gc_pbps_20242025 <- nhlscraper::gc_pbps(20242025)  # Aggregate data. common_cols <- Reduce(   intersect,   list(     names(gc_pbps_20222023),     names(gc_pbps_20232024),     names(gc_pbps_20242025)   ) ) gc_pbps_20222025 <- rbind(   gc_pbps_20222023[common_cols],    gc_pbps_20232024[common_cols],    gc_pbps_20242025[common_cols] )

title: Building and Understanding our Expected Goals (xG) Models
text: Next, prepare play--play data modeling resolving number quirks inconsistencies raw feed. event, attach basic context whether team home away, split game ID season, game type, game number, convert period/time information continuous seconds elapsed game. derive key hockey game-state features drive xG: strength situation (empty net status, skater counts, man-advantage differential, strength state labels), rebound rush indicators, shot-volume measures goals, shots goal, Fenwick (USAT), Corsi (SAT). Finally, normalize coordinates shots taken toward +x direction compute Euclidean distance angle net, restricting dataset non-shootout, non-penalty-shot attempts.
code: # Flag home/away. gc_pbps_20222025_is_home_flagged         <-    nhlscraper::flag_is_home(gc_pbps_20222025)  # Strip game ID. gc_pbps_20222025_game_id_stripped        <-    nhlscraper::strip_game_id(gc_pbps_20222025_is_home_flagged)  # Strip time and period. gc_pbps_20222025_time_period_stripped    <-    nhlscraper::strip_time_period(gc_pbps_20222025_game_id_stripped) # Strip situation code. gc_pbps_20222025_situation_code_stripped <-    nhlscraper::strip_situation_code(gc_pbps_20222025_time_period_stripped)  # Flag rebound shot attempts. gc_pbps_20222025_is_rebound_flagged      <-    nhlscraper::flag_is_rebound(gc_pbps_20222025_situation_code_stripped)  # Flag rush shot attempts. gc_pbps_20222025_is_rush_flagged         <-    nhlscraper::flag_is_rush(gc_pbps_20222025_is_rebound_flagged)  # Count goals, SOG, Fenwick, and Corsi. gc_pbps_20222025_goals_shots_counted     <-    nhlscraper::count_goals_shots(gc_pbps_20222025_is_rush_flagged) # Normalize coordinates to +x. gc_pbps_20222025_coordinates_normalized  <-    nhlscraper::normalize_coordinates(gc_pbps_20222025_goals_shots_counted)  # Calculate distance. gc_pbps_20222025_distance_calculated     <-    nhlscraper::calculate_distance(gc_pbps_20222025_coordinates_normalized)  # Calculate angle. gc_pbps_20222025_angle_calculated        <-    nhlscraper::calculate_angle(gc_pbps_20222025_distance_calculated)  # Keep only shots. gc_shots_20222025 <- gc_pbps_20222025_angle_calculated[   gc_pbps_20222025_angle_calculated$typeDescKey %in%      c('goal', 'shot-on-goal', 'missed-shot', 'blocked-shot'), ]  # Remove shootouts and penalty shots. gc_shots_20222025_final <- gc_shots_20222025[   !(gc_shots_20222025$situationCode %in% c('0101', '1010')), ]  # Indicate goal or not. gc_shots_20222025_final$isGoal <- as.integer(   gc_shots_20222025_final$typeDescKey == 'goal' )

title: Building and Understanding our Expected Goals (xG) Models
text: first model, xG_v1, baseline logistic regression shot success. response isGoal (1 shot goal, 0 otherwise), predictors distance (Euclidean distance shooter net), angle (shot angle relative center net), isEmptyNetAgainst (whether opposing goalie pulled), strengthState (game state time shot, even-strength, power-play, penalty-kill). log-odds scale, distance angle negative coefficients: move farther net shoot sharper angle, probability scoring decreases. strong positive coefficient isEmptyNetAgainstTRUE reflects much easier score empty net. Relative even strength, power-play penalty-kill situations positive effects, indicating higher conversion rates shots taken states, conditional shot occurring.
code: # Build xG model version 1. xG_v1 <- glm(   isGoal ~     distance +     angle +     isEmptyNetAgainst +     strengthState,   family = binomial,   data   = gc_shots_20222025_final )  # Summarize model 1. summary(xG_v1)

title: Building and Understanding our Expected Goals (xG) Models
text: second model, xG_v2, extends baseline specification adding two play-context features: isRebound isRush. response still isGoal, retain predictors xG_v1 (distance, angle, isEmptyNetAgainst, strengthState) allowing model account whether shot rebound (fired shortly previous shot without change possession) rush chance (taken quickly following transition ice). exact definitions defined glossary . Compared xG_v1, coefficients distance, angle, strength-related variables broadly similar, model captures additional structure certain shot types perform. Rebound shots (isReboundTRUE) strongly positive highly significant coefficient, reflecting fact rebounds, average, much dangerous non-rebound attempts distance angle controlled . Rush shots (isRushTRUE) slightly negative coefficient marginal statistical significance conventional levels. suggests , conditional location covariates, rush shots systematically (may even slightly less) efficient non-rush shots sample, even though may intuitively feel dangerous. addition isRebound isRush reduces residual deviance compared xG_v1, indicating modest meaningful improvement model fit preserving core spatial game-state effects.
code: # Build xG model version 2. xG_v2 <- glm(   isGoal ~     distance +     angle +     isEmptyNetAgainst +     strengthState +     isRebound +     isRush,   family = binomial,   data   = gc_shots_20222025_final )  # Summarize model 2. summary(xG_v2)

title: Building and Understanding our Expected Goals (xG) Models
text: third model, xG_v3, builds xG_v2 adding simple game-context variable: goalDifferential. , response isGoal, include spatial play-context predictors previous models (distance, angle, isEmptyNetAgainst, strengthState, isRebound, isRush). new term, goalDifferential, captures score state shooting team’s perspective time shot (example, leading vs. trailing). core coefficients similar xG_v2. Closer, central shots (distance, angle) still substantially dangerous, empty-net attempts remain extremely likely result goals, penalty-kill power-play states continue show elevated finishing rates relative five--five. Rebound shots retain strong positive effect, rush attempts show small negative coefficient marginal statistical significance. new goalDifferential term positive highly significant, indicating , conditional location covariates, shots taken shooting team ahead scoreboard convert slightly higher rates taken game tied team trailing. effect modest magnitude compared big spatial empty-net effects, capture additional structure game context influences finishing. reduction residual deviance relative xG_v2 incremental consistent overall improvement fit.
code: # Build xG model version 3. xG_v3 <- glm(   isGoal ~     distance +     angle +     isEmptyNetAgainst +     strengthState +     isRebound +     isRush +     goalDifferential,   family = binomial,   data   = gc_shots_20222025_final )  # Summarize model 3. summary(xG_v3)

title: Building and Understanding our Expected Goals (xG) Models
text: far ’ve focused xG models built. practice, though, people experience expected goals visual summaries rather coefficient tables. section, show three xG models introduced can used summarize individual games, users free choose model (three earlier) apply.

title: Building and Understanding our Expected Goals (xG) Models
text: first pair plots shows shot attempts one team, normalized always attack right. Marker shape encodes outcome (goal, shot goal, missed, blocked) color encodes shot’s xG bin, low-danger attempts dark blue dangerous chances bright red.  Looking home view, can quickly pick team’s preferred shooting areas. example game, many Panthers’ attempts cluster around slot net-front, several high-xG red markers just crease. pattern consistent team frequently gets inside position, generates tips rebounds, comfortable attacking middle ice. Switching away perspective, Oilers’ shot map looks different. still dangerous chances around crease, also see higher volume lower-xG shots outside point wristers, sharp-angle attempts, quick shots rush never quite reach interior. kind map nice way talk “shot quality vs. shot volume”: team may outshoot opponent raw attempts, blue markers perimeter, expected goals tell balanced story.
code: # Plot shot locations for Game 7 Stanley Cup Finals 2025. ig_game_shot_locations(   game  = 2023030417,    model = 1,    team  = 'H' ) ig_game_shot_locations(   game  = 2023030417,    model = 1,    team  = 'A' )

title: Building and Understanding our Expected Goals (xG) Models
text: second visualization shows cumulative xG seconds elapsed game teams . x-axis runs 0 end regulation, tick marks every 300 seconds (five minutes). y-axis tracks running sum xG, step corresponds new scoring chance; flat stretches indicate long periods without meaningful offense.  example, red line (Florida) blue line (Edmonton) track closely much night. Early , teams climb near lockstep, suggesting fairly even trade chances. Mid-game, Florida opens small xG gap series higher-quality looks, visible steeper red slope around 1,000-1,200 second mark. Edmonton answers back later, narrowing gap sustained push. end regulation lines finish similar heights, Florida holding modest xG edge. classic “deserve--win-o-meter” view: rather arguing shots goals alone, can say Florida generated slightly better chances overall, game competitive throughout.
code: # Plot cumulative xG for Game 7 Stanley Cup Finals 2025. ig_game_cumulative_expected_goals(   game  = 2023030417,    model = 1 )

title: Building and Understanding our Expected Goals (xG) Models
text: useful three xG models , far perfect. deliberately simple, interpretable logistic regressions built limited set features. makes great understanding basic factors like distance, angle, strength state, game situation shape scoring chances, also means plenty room improve predictive power. gap part point nhlscraper. package designed just ship set “finished” xG models, make easy anyone download, clean, reshape NHL data can experiment ; ultimately, goal give tools ask answer hockey questions, whether means building better xG model, evaluating special teams, profiling individual shooters, creating entirely new metrics. come something interesting, ’d love nhlscraper part story.

However, NHL completely transformed API structure, packages became mostly defunct authors understandably chose continue maintaining . community gathered around work Zachary Maludzinski discover share new endpoints, progress naturally slowed “main” endpoints identified. summer 2025, began reverse-engineering many remaining, undocumented endpoints searching additional data future research, particular focus NHL EDGE Records data. shared findings, effort expand refine map APIs accelerated, together, ultimately identified 400+ new endpoints expose wide range NHL data. parallel, also discovered many new endpoints ESPN API, extending beyond Joseph Wilson already compiled.

title: nhlscraper 0.4.2.9000
text: return IDs, codes, names now standardized (.e., arbitrary id columns inconsistent column names across functions). contracts() now added get NHL contracts since 2011-2012 season. ig_game_shot_locations() x_game_shot_locations() now use continuous xG scale instead bins. calculate_expected_goals() now combines previous xG calculation functions; result, calculate_expected_goals_v1(), calculate_expected_goals_v2(), calculate_expected_goals_v3() now defunct. calculate_speed() now added calculate event--event deltas play--plays. add_shooter_biometrics() now added add shooter biometrics Fenewick events play--plays. add_goalie_biometrics() now added add goalie biometrics Fenewick events play--plays. ps() now deprecated; use pss() instead.

title: nhlscraper 0.4.2
